pr_title: Moved Gradle modules out of Groovy cluster

timeline.message: Moved Gradle modules out od Groovy cluster

timeline.bodyText:
Can someone check this who is more familiar with MultiView than I am?
The intention is that gradle scripts are loaded by the plain editor kit if the Groovy support is absent.
As far as I tested it works. As soon as the Groovy plugins got enabled the editor get syntax highlight, though for "efficient" (Groovy) code completion, the IDE needs to be restarted, but I do not think that an issue.
timeline.author: lkishalmi
timeline.diffHunk:

         <folder name="text">
-            <!--folder name="x-gradle+x-groovy">

-                    <attr methodvalue="org.netbeans.modules.csl.core.GsfParserFactory.create" name="instanceCreate"/>
-                    <attr name="instanceOf" stringvalue="org.netbeans.modules.parsing.spi.ParserFactory"/>
+            <folder name="x-gradle+x-groovy">
